1{-# OPTIONS_GHC -Wall #-}
2{-# LANGUAGE ScopedTypeVariables #-}
3
4-- | Relation filter.
5
6module Koshucode.Baala.Rop.Cox.Filter
7  ( ropsCoxFilter,
8  
9    -- * keep & omit
10    consFilter, relmapFilter, relkitFilter,
11  
12    -- * contain
13    consContain, relmapContain, relkitContain,
14  
15    -- * omit-all
16    consOmitAll, relmapOmitAll,
17  ) where
18
19import Prelude hiding (getContents)
20import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Data             as D
21import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Core             as C
22import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Rop.Base         as Op
23import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Rop.Cox.Get      as Op
24import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Rop.Cox.Message  as Msg
25
26
27-- | Implementation of relational operators.
28--
29--   [@keep E@]
30--     Keep tuples @E@ equals true.
31-- 
32--   [@omit E@]
33--     Omit tuples @E@ equals true.
34-- 
35ropsCoxFilter :: (D.CContent c) => [C.Rop c]
36ropsCoxFilter = Op.ropList "cox-filter"
37    --        CONSTRUCTOR         USAGE         ATTRIBUTE
38    [ Op.def  consContain         "contain E"   "-expr"
39    , Op.def  (consFilter True)   "keep E"      "-in* . -where?"
40    , Op.def  (consFilter False)  "omit E"      "-in* . -where?"
41    , Op.def  consOmitAll         "omit-all"    ""
42    ]
43
44
45-- ----------------------  filter
46
47-- | [keep E]
48--     Keep tuples which expression E is true.
49--
50--   [omit E]
51--     Omit tuples which expression E is true.
52--     @omit E@ is equivalent to @keep not E@.
53--
54consFilter :: (D.CContent c) => Bool -> C.RopCons c
55consFilter b med =
56    do cops   <- Op.getWhere med "-where"
57       coxIn  <- Op.getCox med "-in"
58       Right $ relmapFilter med (b, cops, coxIn)
59
60-- | Create @keep@ and @omit@ relmap.
61relmapFilter :: (D.CContent c) => C.Intmed c -> (Bool, D.CopSet c, D.Cox c) -> C.Relmap c
62relmapFilter med = C.relmapFlow med . relkitFilter
63
64-- | Create @keep@ and @omit@ relkit.
65relkitFilter :: (D.CContent c) => (Bool, D.CopSet c, D.Cox c) -> C.RelkitFlow c
66relkitFilter _ Nothing = Right C.relkitNothing
67relkitFilter (which, cops, body) (Just he1) = Right kit2 where
68    kit2  = C.relkitJust he1 $ C.RelkitAbTest p
69    p cs1 = do c <- D.coxRunCox cops he1 cs1 body
70               case D.isBool c of
71                 True  -> Right $ D.gBool c == which
72                 False -> Msg.reqBool
73
74
75-- ----------------------  contain
76
77-- | __contain E__
78--
79--   Keep tuples in which some terms has content E.
80--
81consContain :: (D.CContent c) => C.RopCons c
82consContain med =
83    do c <- Op.getContent med "-expr"
84       Right $ relmapContain med c
85
86-- | Create @contain@ relmap.
87relmapContain :: (Eq c) => C.Intmed c -> c -> C.Relmap c
88relmapContain med = C.relmapFlow med . relkitContain
89
90-- | Create @contain@ relkit.
91relkitContain :: (Eq c) => c -> C.RelkitFlow c
92relkitContain _ Nothing = Right C.relkitNothing
93relkitContain c (Just he1) = Right kit2 where
94    kit2  = C.relkitJust he1 $ C.RelkitAbTest p
95    p cs1 = Right $ c `elem` cs1
96
97
98-- ----------------------  omit-all
99
100-- | __omit-all__
101--
102--   Throw away all tuples.
103--
104consOmitAll :: C.RopCons c
105consOmitAll med = Right $ relmapOmitAll med
106
107-- | Create @omit-all@ relmap.
108relmapOmitAll :: C.Intmed c -> C.Relmap c
109relmapOmitAll med = C.relmapFlow med relkitOmitAll
110
111-- | Create @omit-all@ relkit.
112relkitOmitAll :: C.RelkitFlow c
113relkitOmitAll he1 = Right $ C.relkit he1 $ C.RelkitConst []
114
